Class GamePhaseData

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.view.GamePhaseData
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdventurePhaseData, BuildingPhaseData, CheckPhaseData, EndPhaseData, JoiningPhaseData
public abstract class GamePhaseData extends Object
Abstract base class representing the data and behavior of a client-side game phase. This class encapsulates:
  • A reference to a Controller that listens to phase changes
  • A message from the server (e.g., feedback or errors)
It also defines hooks for:
  • Updating the client view via notifyListener()
  • Handling incoming ServerActions using the Visitor Pattern
  • Identifying the specific phase using isXXXPhase() methods

  • Constructor Details

    • GamePhaseData

      public GamePhaseData()
      Constructs a generic GamePhaseData object.

      Subclasses are expected to provide phase-specific state and behavior.

  • Method Details

    • getListener

      public Controller getListener()
      Returns the current Controller listening for updates to this phase.
      Returns:
      the listener associated with this phase

    • setListener

      public void setListener(Controller listener)
      Sets the Controller that should listen for updates to this phase.
      Parameters:
      listener - the controller to notify

    • notifyListener

      public abstract void notifyListener()
      Notifies the listener that the internal state has changed.

      This method is abstract and must be implemented by each subclass to specify how updates should be propagated to the UI.

    • getServerMessage

      public String getServerMessage()
      Returns the most recent server message (e.g., error or status).
      Returns:
      the server message string

    • setServerMessage

      public void setServerMessage(String serverMessage)
      Sets the server message to be shown to the user.
      Parameters:
      serverMessage - the message received from the server

    • resetServerMessage

      public void resetServerMessage()
      Resets the server message to an empty string.

    • updateState

      public void updateState()
      Updates the internal state of the phase.

      This method is optional and can be overridden by subclasses that maintain state machines or finite-step flows.

    • handle

      public abstract void handle(ServerAction action)
      Handles a ServerAction targeted at this phase's data.

      This method enables the application of the Visitor Pattern: the ServerAction knows how to manipulate this GamePhaseData through its loadData method.

      Parameters:
      action - the server-side action to process

    • isJoiningPhase

      public boolean isJoiningPhase()
      Indicates whether this is the joining phase.
      Returns:
      false by default, overridden in specific phase subclasses

    • isBuildingPhase

      public boolean isBuildingPhase()
      Indicates whether this is the building phase.
      Returns:
      false by default, overridden in specific phase subclasses

    • isCheckPhase

      public boolean isCheckPhase()
      Indicates whether this is the check phase.
      Returns:
      false by default, overridden in specific phase subclasses

      public boolean isAdventurePhase()
      Indicates whether this is the adventure phase.
      Returns:
      false by default, overridden in specific phase subclasses

    • isEndPhase

      public boolean isEndPhase()
      Indicates whether this is the end phase.
